refnamediv.refpurpose: LaTeX location for admonition graphics

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The file path that will be passed to LaTeX in order to find admonition graphics.
An empty value suppresses the use of admonition graphics.
If your figures are in "the current directory" then use a value of "." (i.e. the full stop or period on its own) to signify this.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the escaping of alt text

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ext within alt elements is assumed to be valid LaTeX and is passed through unescaped by default (though you should set its value to "plain" or "latex", which are considered confirmative and equivalent by DB2LaTeX). If this is not appropriate for your document, set this variable to the empty value. If you use an explicit <role> attribute with the values "latex" or "tex", you need not concern yourself with this variable. Alt text within equation-type elements is currently assumed to be valid LaTeX regardless of this variable (this is probably a bug!).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Display remark and comment elements?

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Enables or disables the display of comments and remarks. By default, this is equal to param.latex.is.draft.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the display of othername elements in authors

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When disabled, othername elements will be suppressed when author elements are formatted.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Separator for bibliography items
Cull table-of-contents entries that are deeply nested

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the maximum depth before sections are omitted from the table of contents.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the automatic numbering of section, parts, and chapters

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the maximum depth before sections cease to be uniquely numbered. This is passed to LaTeX using the secnumdepth counter. Therefore, it is possible to use a value of "0" (zero) to disable section numbering. A value of "-1" will disable the numbering of parts and chapters, too.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Default filename extension for includegraphics

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specify the LaTeX search parameters for graphics filenames. If empty, DB2LaTeX will specify some explicit defaults.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control mediaobject selection methods

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This controls how DB2LaTeX behaves when a figure contains multiple mediaobjects. When enabled, DB2LaTeX will prefer the <mediaobject> with the "latex", "tex" or param.preferred.mediaobject.role role, if any.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control mediaobject selection methods

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When param.use.role.for.mediaobject is enabled, this variable can be used to specify the mediaobject <role> that your document uses for LaTeX output. DB2LaTeX will try to use this role before using the "latex" or "tex" roles. For example, some authors may choose to set this to "pdf".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Specifies where formal component titles should occur

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Titles for the formal object types (figure, example, quation, table, and procedure) can be placed before or after those objects. The keyword "before" is recognised. All other strings qualify as "after".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the appearance of page numbers in cross references

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When enabled, xrefs will include page numbers after their generated cross-reference text.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the display of URLs after ulinks

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this option is enabled, and a ulink has a URL that is different from the displayed content, the URL will be typeset after the content. If the URL and content are identical, only one of them will appear. Otherwise, the URL is hyperlinked and the content is not.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the generation of footnotes for ulinks

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this option is enabled, a ulink that has content different to its URL will have an associated footnote. The contents of the footnote will be the URL. If the ulink is within a footnote, the URL is shown after the content.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Honour role as proxy for xrefstyle

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The <xrefstyle> attribute is not yet part of DocBook so the <role> attribute can be used until xrefstyle is available for xref elements.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Choose whether to include manvolnum in cross-references

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this option is enabled, manvolnums will be displayed when cross-referencing refentries.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the use of NAME headers

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See http://docbook.sourceforge.net/release/xsl/current/doc/fo/refentry.generate.name.html.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Process only one element tree within a document

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this variable is non-empty, it is interpreted as the ID of an element that should be typeset by DB2LaTeX. The element's children, but none of its siblings or ancestors, will be processed as per normal. When the root element is a book or article, that component will have its normal infrastructure (including bookinfo or articleinfo) processed before the "rootid" element.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX document class

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This variable is normally empty and the stylesheets will determine the correct document class according to whether the document is a book or an article. If you wish to use your own document class, put its non-empty value in this variable. It will apply for both books and articles.

refnamediv.refpurpose: The \maketitle for books and articles.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Some users may wish to override or eliminate \maketitle.
Does not apply to <article>s within <book>s.
By default, uses LaTeX \maketitle with the 'empty' pagestyle for the first page. The page style of subsequent pages is determined by template.generate.latex.pagestyle.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Controls what is output after the LaTeX preamble.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Default values decrease edge margins and allow a large quantity of figures to be set on each page.

refnamediv.refpurpose: All purpose commands to change text width, height, counters, etc. Defaults to a two-sided margin layout.
Begin document command
LaTeX code that is output after the author (e.g. \makeglossary)
Format the output of tabular headings.
Format the output of tabular footers.
Control the style of inline monospaced text

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is passed directly to LaTeX. Typically, it is \frenchspacing\texttt.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of article titles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is passed directly to LaTeX. Typically, it is either a \command or an empty string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of article titles within books

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is passed directly to LaTeX. Typically, it is either a \command or an empty string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of authors and dates within a book's articles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is passed directly to LaTeX. Typically, it is either a \command or an empty string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of equation captions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Figure captions are typeset in the default typeface (usually 'roman') but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the caption and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of example captions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Figure captions are typeset in the default typeface (usually 'roman') but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the caption and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of figure captions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Figure captions are typeset in the default typeface (usually 'roman') but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the caption and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of figure titles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Figure titles are typeset in the default typeface (usually 'roman') but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the title and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of equation captions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The titles of formalparas are typeset in the bold typeface by default. This parameter can be set to an alternative LaTeX command, such as textit (or empty).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of list titles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: List titles are typeset in small caps but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the title and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of admonition titles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Admonition titles are typeset in small bold caps but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the title and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of procedure titles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Procedure titles are typeset in small caps but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the title and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of segtitles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is passed directly to LaTeX. Typically, it is either a \command or an empty string.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of step titles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Step titles are typeset in small caps but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the title and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the style of table captions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Figure captions are typeset in the default typeface (usually 'roman') but if this option is set to a LaTeX command, such as \textit, then that command will precede the caption and it will be typeset accordingly.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Override DB2LaTeX's choice of LaTeX page numbering style

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, DB2LaTeX will choose the 'plain' or 'fancy' page styles, depending on param.latex.use.fancyhdr. If non-empty, this variable overrides the automatic selection. An example would be the literal string 'empty', to eliminate headers and page numbers.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX hyperref options

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: In addition to this variable, you can specify additional options using latex.hyperref.param.pdftex or latex.hyperref.param.dvips.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX hyperref options for pdfTeX output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See the hyperref documentation for further information.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX hyperref options for dvips output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See the hyperref documentation for further information.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Options for the varioref LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Support index generation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the varioref LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Support index generation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Choose indentation for tabs in verbatim environments

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When param.latex.use.fancyvrb is enabled, this variable sets the width of a tab in terms of an equivalent number of spaces.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Insert LaTeX options for fancyvrb Verbatim environments
Control the use of the inputenc LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If this option is non-empty, the inputenc package will be used with the specified encoding. This should agree with the your driver file. For example, the default value of latin1 is compatible with docbook.xsl, which contains <xsl:output method="text" encoding="ISO-8859-1" indent="yes"/>
If this option is empty, the inputenc package will not be invoked by DB2LaTeX.
inputenc is a LaTeX base package.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Options for the fontenc package
Select the optional parameter(s) for the unicode LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See the unicode documentation for details.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Select the optional parameter for the babel LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See the babel documentation for details.

Although DB2LaTeX will try to choose the correct babel options for your document, you may need to specify the correct choice here. The special value of 'none' (without the quotes) will cause DB2LaTeX to skip babel configuration.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Adjust bibliography formatting

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The environment bibliography accepts a parameter that indicates the widest label, which is used to correctly format the bibliography output. The value of this parameter is output inside the \begin{thebibliography[]} LaTeX command.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX document class options

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
These are the first options to be passed to \documentclass (The common options are
blank by default.) They will be augmented or superseded by article/book options (see $latex.documentclass.article and $latex.documentclass.book) and pdftex/dvips options (see $latex.documentclass.pdftex and $latex.documentclass.dvips).

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX document class options for articles

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The article options are set to a4paper,10pt,twoside,twocolumn by default. These are the intermediate options to be passed to \documentclass, between the common options and the pdftex/dvips options.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX document class options for books

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The book options are set to a4paper,10pt,twoside,openright by default. These are the intermediate options to be passed to \documentclass, between the common options and the pdftex/dvips options.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX document class options for pdfTeX output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The pdfTeX options are empty by default. These are the last options to be passed to \documentclass and override the common/article/book options.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX document class options for dvips output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The dvips options are empty by default. These are the last options to be passed to \documentclass and override the common/article/book options.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX graphics admonitions size

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Is passed as an optional parameter for \includegraphics and can take on any such legal values (or be empty).

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX allows using an (externally generated) cover page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: You may supply a LaTeX file that will supersede DB2LaTeX's default cover page or title. If the value of this variable is non-empty, the generated LaTeX code includes \input{filename}. Otherwise, it uses the \maketitle command.

Bear in mind that using an external cover page breaks the "encapsulation" of DocBook. Further revisions of these stylesheets will add chunking support, and the automation of the cover file generation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Document Font(s)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Document fonts can be chosen by providing LaTeX package names. Common values include default, times, palatcm, charter, helvet, palatino, avant, newcent and bookman. Particular combinations may also work. For example, mathptm,charter,courier.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Override DB2LaTeX's preamble with a custom preamble.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this variable is set, the entire DB2LaTeX premable will be superseded. You should not normally need or want to use this. It may cause LaTeX typesetting problems. This is a last resort or "expert" feature.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the display of captions in lists of figures.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, lists of figures (see template.lot) will include both figure titles and mediaobject captions. This is useful for readers, as they have a full description of each figure. However, it is impractical for large documents because the list of figures will occupy too many pages.

This variable, when set to '1', authorises DB2LaTeX to include mediaobject captions in lists of figures. It is enabled by default. When set to '0', lists of figures will contain only the titles of figures.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the output of the \bibliography{.bib}.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The value of this parameter is output.
An example is "citations.bib", if your BibTeX file has that name.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Controls the output of LaTeX packages and commands to support documents with math commands and environments.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If this parameter is set to 1, the stylesheets generate code to DEFAULT: 1 Only more code is generated.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Controls if the revision history table is generated as the first document table.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If this parameter is set to 1, the stylesheets generate code to DEFAULT: 1 Only more code is generated.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Options for fancybox
Controls the output of LaTeX commands to support the generation of PDF files.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If this parameter is set to 1, the stylesheets generate code to detect if it is either latex or pdflatex the shell command that is being used to compile the LaTeX text file. Some packages (graphicx, hyperref) are used with the right parameters. Finally, the graphic extensions declared, to use in \includegraphics commands depends also on which command is being used. If this parameter is set to zero, such code is not generated (which does not mean that the file cannot compile with pdflatex, but some strange issues may appear). DEFAULT: 1 Only more code is generated.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable the generation of indexterms

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Support index generation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: DB2LaTeX hyphenation linebreak tricks

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Usually, LaTeX does not perform hyphenation in "teletype" (monospace) text. This can lead to formatting problems. But certain monospace texts, such as URLs and filenames, have "natural" breakpoints such as full stops and slashes. DB2LaTeX's "tttricks" exploit a hyphenation trick in order to provide line wrapping in the middle of monospace text. Set this to '1' to enable these tricks (they are not enabled by default). See also the FAQ.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Decimal point for LaTeX tables

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is a non-localisable character that may be used for decimal alignment of LaTeX tables.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the trimming of leading and trailing whitespace in verbatim environments

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: In verbatim environments such as programlisting and screen, it can be useful to trim leading and trailing whitespace. However, this is not compliant with The Definitive Guide.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the ltxtable LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If this package is used, then tables will be have the capability to run over multiple pages when necessary.
One downside is that some 'narrow' tables might fill the entire width of the column when ltxtable is enabled.
Cells spanning multiple columns may require extra passes with LaTeX in order for column widths to 'converge'.
This is not implemented as true ltxtable support, yet. It uses longtable until we can integrate proper ltxtable support. One the feature is supported, it should probably be enabled by default!

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the longtable LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Enabling this option allows simplelists to run over multiple pages. In the future, it will be superseded by param.latex.use.ltxtable.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the overpic LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Facilitates overlays (for callouts).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the umoline LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Provide underlining.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the url LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Provide partial support for hyperlinks.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the the draft preamble

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DB2LaTeX provides a number of draft-mode features to aid the refinement of documents. Normally, this mode is enabled or disabled according to the <status> attribute of the top-level book or article element. However, this variable will take precedence when it is not empty. It is empty by default.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the varioref LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: varioref seemed like a good idea at first, but we not realise it does understand DocBook gentext localisations. By default, it is enabled when param.insert.xref.page.number is enabled.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the fancyhdr LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Provides page headers and footers. Disabling support for this package will make headers and footer go away.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the inclusion of chapter titles in lots

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this variable is set, lists of tables and lists of figures will be grouped and labeled by chapter.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Configure the application of truncation partitions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: For param.latex.fancyhdr.truncation.partition, the partition can be modulated in a left-right fashion or an inside-outside fashion. Use "lr" for left-right, all other values are inside-outside ("io" is suggested). The default is "io", because this matches param.latex.documentclass.book.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Configure the width of header portions on each page

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: It is possible that the titles of chapter or sections will occupy more than the width of a single line. When this variable is empty, headers will be allowed to occupy multiple lines. However, it is possible that the left-hand portion of a header will collide with the right-hand portion of header. To prevent this, headers can be truncated if they exceed an allowable width. When this variables is set to a number from zero to 100, the left-hand (or inside) side of each header will have that width reserved. The right-hand (or outside) side will have the remainder. A common option is to set this variable to zero and set param.latex.fancyhdr.truncation.style to "io".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Section/chapter style for fancy headers

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: DB2LaTeX comes with some pre-configured styles for page headers. These include "", the default, which is determined by the fancyhdr package. Another option is "natural", in which both the chapter and section are shown on each page with their numbers. An alternative is to provide your own template.generate.latex.pagestyle template with a value such as \pagestyle{headings} (the "headings" page style, which is not a fancyhdr style, shows page numbers in the headers whereas the others show page numbers in the footers).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the parskip LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use "block" paragraph style instead of indentation.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of noindent commands

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this parameter is 1, DB2LaTeX will deliberately insert noindents at particular locations within your document.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the subfigure LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Used to provide nice layout of multiple mediaobjects in figures.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the rotating LaTeX package
Toggle the use of the tabularx LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Used to provide certain table features. Has some incompatabilities with packages, but also solves some conflicts that the regular tabular environment has.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the dcolumn LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Currently, dcolumn support does not function correctly.
dcolumn provides support for the char alignment of table cells.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the hyperref LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is used extensively for hyperlinking within documents.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the fancybox LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This is essential for admonitions.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the fancyvrb LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Provides support for tabbed whitespace in verbatim environments. See also param.latex.fancyvrb.tabsize.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Toggle the use of the isolatin1 LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This option is deprecated. See param.latex.inputenc.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Choose whether to use the unicode LaTeX package

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: See the unicode documentation for details.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control which references are cited in the bibliography

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The DB2LaTeX generated bibliography (bibitems) may either include all biblioentries found in the document, or only thee ones explicitly cited with <citation>.
Two values are possible: "all" or "cited".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control bibliographic citation style

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, this value is empty. Alternatively, a special value is recognised: "ieee" (or "IEEE").

refnamediv.refpurpose: Improved typesetting of captions

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
DB2LaTeX supports $formal.title.placement as a mechanism for choosing whether captions will appear above or below the objects they describe.
However, LaTeX will often produce an ugly result when captions occur above their corresponding content. This usually arises because of unsuitable \abovecaptionskip and \belowcaptionskip.
This variable, when set to '1', authorises DB2LaTeX to swap the caption 'skip' lengths when a caption is placed above its corresponding content. This is enabled by default.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control imagedata selection.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This controls how DB2LaTeX behaves when a <mediaobject> contains multiple <imagedata>. When non-empty, DB2LaTeX will exclude imagedata that have a format no listed within this variable.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control Unicode character handling.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Normally, XSLT processors will convert SGML character entities into Unicode characters and DB2LaTeX doesn't have much chance to do anything toward converting them to LaTeX equivalents. We do not yet know how we can solve this problem best.

Proposed values: 'catcode', 'unicode', 'extension'. Currently only 'catcode' is supported. All other values will cause no special handling except for certain mappings in MathML. In future, perhaps the 'unicode' LaTeX package could be of assistance. 'Extension' could be an XSLT extension that handles the characters using a mapping table.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the use of otherterm attributes

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When a glosssee or glossseealso element contains both an "otherterm" attribute and content templates, this variable elects which will be the source of the displayed text. By default, this variable is enabled and a cross-reference to the otherwterm will be generated (i.e. content templates will be ignored).

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the use of alt text

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: By default, DB2LaTeX assumes that <alt> text should be typeset in preference to any <mediaobject>s.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Whether to apply templates for component titles.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Controls whether component titles will be generated by applying templates or by conversion to string values. When enabled, templates will be applied. This enables template expression in titles but may have problematic side-effects such as nested links.
This variable does not influence all <title> elements. Some may have their own configuration variables or be non-configurable.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Whether to apply templates for admonition titles.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Controls whether admonition titles will be generated by applying templates or by conversion to string values. When enabled, templates will be applied.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Whether to delimit URLs with quotation characters

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this option is enabled, gentext quotation characters (urlstartquote and urlendquote) are used to delimit the URLs when they are displayed as part of ulink formatting. The delimiters do not form part of the URL or hyperlink per se.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control string comparison for ulinks

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The formatting of a ulink element varies according to whether its <url> attribute differs from its content. When this option is enabled, the comparison between these two values ignores the "protocol" portion of the URL (that which occurs before ':' or '://', as a concession to HTTP URLs). For example, when this option is enabled, "a.b.c/d" would be considered equivalent to "http://a.b.c/d" and "file:a.b.c/d".

refnamediv.refpurpose: Control the suppression of headers/footers on blank pages in double-side documents

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: When this option is enabled, DB2LaTeX will attempt to suppress headers and footers on pages that contain no other content (i.e. left-handed pages in a double-sided document). When this option is disabled, DB2LaTeX does not interfere with the default appearance of headers and footers.
